name: EU Asia Financial Services Roundtable
goal: The EU-Asia Financial Services Roundtable promotes a shared understanding of the regulatory issues faced by financial markets participants in Europe and Asia, while also shaping the EU-Asian regulatory and policy discussions.
interests: Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Enlargement, External Relations, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Fraud prevention, General and Institutional Affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives: The EU-Asia Financial Services Roundtable follows all EU and Asian discussions impacting cross-border financial services regulation and policy between the two regions, including the extraterritorial application of rules, trade negotiations, as well as regulatory and supervisory cooperation at international level and between the two regions.
